ggbscript.val: #this is an answer point for the dilated triangle #it is always shown because the coordinates of D and E never change
#this is an answer point for the dilated triangle #it is always shown because the coordinates of D and E never change
#this translates the possible solutions to the region that we start in
#this is used to generate the typical error points which are a reflection over the perpendicular bisector of DE
#points that the solution will snap to #this includes the possible solutions as well as other random points

ggbscript.onUpdate: #this is a random list of points that the movable point will snap to. This also includes the 2 possible solution points

ggbscript.val: #this is a point that is movable. It snaps to points in snapPoints which includes the possible solutions

ggbscript.onUpdate:
#SetCoords(AnswerPoint, x(SimMove), y(SimMove)) SetCoords(SimMoveCopy, x(SimMove), y(SimMove))
#SetValue(moved, 1) #SetValue(enableBtnValidate, true)

expression.label: MidDEFFinal
expression.exp: ((Max[Zip[x(n), n, {answerTriangleD, answerTriangleE, SimMove}]] + Min[Zip[x(n), n, {answerTriangleD, answerTriangleE, SimMove}]]) / 2, (Max[Zip[y(n), n, {answerTriangleD, answerTriangleE, SimMove}]] + Min[Zip[y(n), n, {answerTriangleD, answerTriangleE, SimMove}]]) / 2)

expression.label: D
expression.exp: ((Max[Zip[x(n), n, {A, B, C}]] + Min[Zip[x(n), n, {A, B, C}]]) / 2, (Max[Zip[y(n), n, {A, B, C}]] + Min[Zip[y(n), n, {A, B, C}]]) / 2)
